ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Writing and speaking in Spanish for most people; listening, speaking, and writing (in that order) for me who has taken the AP class without the AP exam.
Really developed my spoken Spanish fluency and was able to clean up my writing skills!
I practiced my oral skills and improved my writing skills in Spanish through the feedback of my instructor.
Revisiting my Spanish was hard but worth it. I learned new vocabulary and greatly worked on my grammar.

Furthered my speaking, reading comprehension, and writing skills. This is not the course to take if you want a better understanding of grammar. This is very much focused on speaking and writing, and if you do not want to focus on these, I do not suggest this course. But if you do, I 100% recommend it!

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Strengths: grading is fair, teacher is supportive, topics are not as boring as they seem (I actually learned a bit about topics like morality)
Weaknesses: I wish that we could spend more time on the novel
Great discussion style. Format of the class, order of assignments, and methods of pedagogy were super effective
I think it was an effective course as is.

Professor Maria Vazquez is one of the biggest strengths! She is a great and understanding professor, and if she is teaching a section, I recommend you take hers. The only weakness is that sometimes there can be a lot of small tasks that can feel useless and time consuming, but if you have a good understanding of Spanish, they should be easy to handle.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I think the instructor did a good job of providing support for student learning. If anything, presentations and debates are made way easier this way.
The group project was fun to do.
Everything worked well.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes

Definitely would recommend for another student like me who's okay in Spanish, get tired of the topics in AP and perhaps want to take a cooler elective, but definitely not good enough to take a full-on Spanish lit course. If that's you, take this class because you will improve a lot and A is definitely within reach.
Yes!! Great opportunity to brush up on spanish skills.
I would recommend this course to students seeking to complete their language L5 requirements or native Spanish speakers who wish to practice their Spanish after not speaking it for a long time
Yes, especially those whose Spanish is rusty and are looking to challenge themselves.
This is a good language course for anyone trying to complete a foreign language requirement.
100%! Especially if Prof Vazquez is teaching it.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: virtual seminar
Linguameeting website for 1 on 1 conversations with native speakers
Group work.
We had to do several Linguameeting sessions.
n/a
